I just want to figure out what made this man tic.

item.title: On Computable Numbers, with an Application to the Entscheidungsproblem
item.description: <!doctype html> On Computable Numbers, with an Application to the Entscheidungsproblem | The Thaumatorium ON COMPUTABLE NUMBERS, WITH AN APPLICATION TO THE ENTSCHEIDUNGSPROBLEM By A. M. TURING. [Received 28 May, 1936.—Read 12 November, 1936.] The “computable” numbers may be described briefly as the real numbers whose expressions as a decimal are calculable by finite means. Although the subject of this paper is ostensibly the computable numbers, it is almost equally easy to define and investigate computable functions of an integral variable or a real or computable variable, computable predicates, and so forth.
